title: Does an asteroid heading towards Earth have a 0.41 percent chance of hitting the planet? - Quora

response.answer_text: Quite obviously not. There are thousands of asteroids, and at any one time about half of them will be heading towards the earth, and we are not continually bombarded with asteroids. In fact, there is only on record of one object over 50m across in the history of mankind (Tungusta) to have hit earth, so it is quite a rare event.
